application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Details pursuant to the discharge of Condition 4 (Materials) of planning permission ref. 27354/APP/2021/1291, dated 01-09-21 (Erection of a three storey building comprising a dental surgery and 6 residential units (3 x 1-bed units, 1 x 3-bed unit and 2 x 2-bed units), car and cycle parking and associated works, temporary permission for the siting of a modular building to the rear of the site for use as a dental surgery during the demolition of the existing dental surgery and construction of the proposed dental surgery)
decision_conditions: The applicant has failed to demonstrate the development would present a satisfactory appearance, essential to ensure a compatible and contextual appearance, to safeguard the character of the area, all contrary to Policy BE1 of the Hillingdon Unitary Development Plan Saved Policies (November 2012), Policy DMHB 11 and DMHB12 of the Hillingdon Local Plan - Part Two; Policies D4 and D8 of the London plan (2021) and the NPPF.

In dealing with the application the Council has implemented the requirement in the National Planning Policy Framework to work with the applicant in a positive and proactive way. The Council's supports pre-application discussions.

In order to ensure that the applicant has been given every opportunity to submit an application which is likely to be considered favourably. In addition further guidance was offered to the applicant by the case officer during the processing of the application to identify the amendments to address those elements of the scheme considered unacceptable which the applicant chose not to implement.
